Package org.jtrim2.event.track

Class TriggeredEvent<ArgType>

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.event.track.TriggeredEvent<ArgType>
Type Parameters:
ArgType - the type of the event argument
public final class TriggeredEvent<ArgType> extends Object
Defines an event which has occurred or yet to be occur. The event is defined by an event specific argument and the kind of event occurred. The kind of event usually specifies the method of an interface to be notified.

Unlike the event specific argument itself, instances of TriggeredEvent should describe the exact event.

The TriggeredEvent overrides equals and hashCode to be equal to other TriggeredEvent, if and only, if they have the same event kind and event argument (the equivalence is based on the equals method).

Thread safety

The methods of this class are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently. In case the event argument and the event kind are immutable (and they are recommended to be immutable), instances of this class are immutable as well.

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this class are synchronization transparent.

  • Constructor Details

    • TriggeredEvent

      public TriggeredEvent(Object eventKind, ArgType eventArg)
      Creates a new TriggeredEvent with the specified event kind and event argument.
      Parameters:
      eventKind - the kind of the event occurred. This argument cannot be null.
      eventArg - the event specific argument. This argument can be null if null argument is allowed for the specified kind of events.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified event kind is null

  • Method Details

    • getEventKind

      public Object getEventKind()
      Returns the kind of event occurred specified at construction time.

      The kind of event usually specifies the method of an interface to be notified.

      Returns:
      the kind of event occurred specified at construction time. This method never returns null.

    • getEventArg

      public ArgType getEventArg()
      Returns the event specific argument specified at construction time.

      The exact meaning of this event argument depends on the kind of event occurred.

      Returns:
      the event specific argument specified at construction time. This method may return null if null was specified at construction time.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Checks whether this TriggeredEvent and the given object equals.

      This method always returns false if the specified object is not an instance of TriggeredEvent. Otherwise, this method returns true, if and only, if the the event kind and the event argument of both this and the specified TriggeredEvent equals (based on the equals method).

      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to which this TriggeredEvent is to be compared to. This argument can be null, in which case, false is returned.
      Returns:
      true if the specified object is a TriggeredEvent and has equivalent event kind and event argument as this TriggeredEvent, false otherwise
